message:
SYSTEM: Wiki: https://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/SEALSTestData 

In this section we give an example on how to use the Tools Repository Service by registering a tool and adding a version for this tool to the repository. Assume we want to submit the IRIS reasoner to the Tool Repository Service, which has the following metadata.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:Tool>
        <seals:hasName rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">IRIS</seals:hasName>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">Open-source Datalog reasoner implemented in Java</dcterms:description>
        <seals:hasExternalURL rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">
http://www.iris-reasoner.org
"</hasExternalURL>
        <seals:hasToolCategory rdf:resource="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#ReasonerOrStorageTool
" />
    </seals:Tool>
</rdf:RDF>
First, we register the tool along with the metadata shown above by creating a HTTP request with the content type
application/x-www-form-urlencoded
, consisting of single key-value pair for the RDF/XML encoded metadata, where
metadata
is the name of the pair. The HTTP request is then sent to the following URI using the HTTP method
POST
:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/
The status code of the HTTP response will indicate the success of the operation. If the operation was invoked successfully, the status code will be
201
and the body will contain the RDF/XML encoded metadata added to the repository, similar to the following:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:Tool rdf:about="
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
">
        <seals:hasName rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">IRIS</seals:hasName>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">Open-source Datalog reasoner implemented in Java</dcterms:description>
        <seals:hasExternalURL rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">
http://www.iris-reasoner.org
"</hasExternalURL>
        <seals:hasToolCategory rdf:resource="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#ReasonerOrStorageTool
" />
        <dcterms:identifier rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66</dcterms:identifier>
        <dcterms:created rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime
">2011-01-25T16:42:14.518+01:00</dcterms:created>
    </seals:Tool>
</rdf:RDF>
Additionally, the HTTP header
Content-Location
will contain the URL of the newly created resource for the tool. This URL will have the following form:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
Assume we want to add version 0.7.3 of the tool. In order to do this we create a HTTP request with the content type
multipart/form-data
, consisting of a part
metadata
, which contains the RDF/XML encoded metadata of the tool version, as shown below, and a part
data
, which streams the tool version packed in a ZIP file
iris-0.7.3.zip
.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:ToolVersion>
        <seals:hasVersionNumber rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">0.7.3</seals:hasVersionNumber>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">Version 0.7.3 of the IRIS Datalog reasoner</dcterms:description>
    </seals:ToolVersion>
</rdf:RDF>
The HTTP request is then sent to the URL of the tool using the HTTP method
POST
, which is
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
, which has the effect, that the tool version is added to the collection of versions. This is also reflected in the metadata of the tool, which from now on has an additional property "seals:hasVersion
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/2d3c6d00-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
".
The status code of the HTTP response will indicate the success of the operation. If the operation was invoked successfully, the status code will be
201
and the body will contain the RDF/XML encoded metadata added to the repository, similar to the following:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:ToolVersion rdf:about="
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/2d3c6d00-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
">
        <seals:hasVersionNumber rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">0.7.3</seals:hasVersionNumber>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">Version 0.7.3 of the IRIS Datalog reasoner</dcterms:description>
        <dcterms:identifier rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">2d3c6d00-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66</dcterms:identifier>
        <dcterms:created rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime
">2011-01-25T16:44:15.623+01:00</dcterms:created>
    </seals:ToolVersion>
</rdf:RDF>
Additionally, the HTTP header
Content-Location
will contain the URL of the newly created resource for the tool version. This URL will have the following form:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/tools/35ded060-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/2d3c6d00-287e-11e0-91fa-0800200c9a66/
Test Data Repository Service (from the SEALS wiki)

(Inserted here since that wiki is restricted)
This page provides documentation of the
Test Data Repository Service
(TDRS), which provides storage and retrieval facilities for test data.
Information

Detailed technical information about using the TDRS is documented in
D5.2
and
D5.4-1.1-FR
.
Environments

A
production environment
running
TDRS 1.1-b
is hosted at
http://seals.sti2.at/tdrs-web/
Information about the repository metadata can be found at
Repository Metadata
Information about the suite metadata can be found at
Suite Metadata
The documentation of the REST interface can be found in chapter 2 of
D5.2
A usage example can be found in section 5.3 of
D5.2
A
test environment
running
TDRS 1.1
is hosted at
http://seals-test.sti2.at/tdrs-web/
Information about the repository metadata can be found at
Repository Metadata (New)
Information about the suite metadata can be found at
Suite Metadata
The documentation of the REST interface can be found at
Test Data Repository Service REST API
A usage example can be found in Section 4.4 of
D5.4-1.1-FR
Changelog
speaker: SYSTEM
